style_notes: Cinematic editorial photography with art direction inspired by high-end magazine spreads. Think Kinfolk meets sacred art. Dramatic use of light, shadow, and negative space. Each image tells a story through objects and atmosphere rather than people.
color_palette: Warm earth tones, Mediterranean palette - terracotta, sand, olive, aged bronze, sun-bleached linen, weathered stone

images.title: Why I'm Writing This
images.concept: The act of careful investigation and writing - Luke as historian and artist
images.prompt: Cinematic overhead editorial photograph, ancient writing desk scene, partially unrolled papyrus scroll with visible texture alongside reed pen and bronze inkwell, scattered research notes on worn parchment, afternoon sun streaming through unseen window casting dramatic diagonal shadows of window frame across the composition, dust particles visible in light beams, weathered olive wood desk surface with natural grain, small stack of bound manuscripts in background blur, color palette of warm amber, aged parchment cream, oxidized bronze and walnut brown, ultra-wide 16:9 composition with subject in left third, massive breathing room, Kinfolk magazine aesthetic, professional product photography, 85mm lens, shallow depth of field, natural film grain
